cleanup_intermediate_files_irods_extract.help_text: Delete intermediate CRAM files downloaded from IRODS in work/ folder

preexisting_fastq_tag.help_text:
If the expected output fastq files exist in the folder named like this under the result folder for the sample e.g. in results/12345_1#67/raw_fastq/12345_1#67_1.fastq.gz,
            then skip download and any further processing for this sample.

split_sep_for_ID_from_fastq.help_text: Separator to recognise sample ID from preexisting file.

lane_plex_sep.help_text: Separator to build sample ID from runid, laneid and plexid. Defaults to '#', which is the iRODS-native syntax.

save_method.help_text: Save output files in per sample folders (nested) or in one folder (flat)

irods_subset_to_skip.help_text: Skip data items for which metadata field 'subset' is set to this value

combine_same_id_crams.help_text: If retrieving read files representing subsets of the same source (files will share the same run, lane and plex IDs), should these files be combined into a 'total' subset i.e. reforming the source read file before subsetting by NPG processing.

large_data.help_text: If the data is very large instead start from the week queue with more memory (10GB)

read_type.help_text: Platform the data you wish to receive was sequenced on Illumina|ont

save_metadata.help_text: If true, save all lane/sample metadata into a CSV file named 'metadata_irods_queried_<datetime>.csv'. If `combine_same_id_crams` is also true, an additional CSV file named 'metadata_combined_readsets_<datetime>.csv' will be created. This does not change how FASTQ files are created.

short_metacsv_name.help_text: Use a short date instead of a full timestamp in metadata filenames.
